Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Mahyar B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite old, rooms were small and beds were tiny. I stayed there for 6 nights and had almost the same Breakfast everyday. The staff were absolutely rude and helpless. However, it's placed in a quiet area, near the underground station and you can simply walk to Istiklal street. It's very easy to get there from the airport. You can take a bus to Taksim which costs you 10 TL and get off in the last bus stop, cross the street and you'll see the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For sure not a 4 stars hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Travelz0r
Reviews.Content: I would rather say a 3 star hotel. The only good thing in the hotel was the location, it was right next Taksim, where you could walk and find many interesting places: restaurants, shops etc... First of all, rooms weren't clean and too small. The hotel was really old, there was a nasty smell when entering the hotel, staff weren't the best at talking English. Lights were really weak, and gave a bad look for the hotel. Pool was dirty and rules weren't respected at all. People where diving with there clothes on, terrible! I'm sure there was better hotels in the region!

Reviews.Title: “Where Turkish Airlines sends their stranded passengers”
Reviews.Author: raobert
Reviews.Content: This 4 stars hotel is used by a lot of people in Istanbul and it is where we landed for 2 nights after our THY flight was cancelled.THY paid our full board, fortunately: on inspection we discovered that the room price was 235 EUR/night, breakfast included. Now this is a ridiculous high price for the service offered there: the rooms are so-so, they are small with microscopic windows and overheated by a locked airco. Bathroom is nice, and breakfast is a treat. Staff are not very friendly. Free Wifi is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accomodation, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: senkayu
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located just 50 m from Taksim square, commercial center of newer part of Istanbul. All around it are small streets full of restaurants, cafes, souvenir shops. Just walk down the hill and you may find yourself in busy Osmanbay, great shopping zone. From Taksim take Istikal street (pedestrians zone) that will take you for kilometers of walk, enjoying lifeful joy of city impuls beating in this street. Hotel itself is quite regular, check ina and out procedure could not be faster, rooms exceptablr, breakfast ok, stuff kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “not the best,but not the worst...”
Reviews.Author: Kemalk_52
Reviews.Content: Perfect location:))) just few meters to airport shuttle and main square.... Property very frequently visited by neareast and east-europe guests...rooms,service and breakfast are acceptable but just on the edge.....not the beaten,but not the worst...should not be the first choice ...good for 1-2 days...

Reviews.Title: “A 2 or 1 star hotel with the 4 stars sign on the front door”
Reviews.Author: Stan040
Reviews.Content: The only good think about this property is its location. The rest is terrible. Plus - the "bar" prices its drinks as served in a real 5 star surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect istanbulic stay”
Reviews.Author: Louloutraveler
Reviews.Content: I've been in istanbul with my husband in april 2011.we reserved a regular room and for our luck got a last floor room that is more spacious than any room in the hotel.it had bosphorous view and a balcony (which we couldnt benefit from a lot as it was very cold oytside). The staff were helpful, and the rooms were cleaned AND demessed every morning. Perfect for staying in istanbul no matter where u want to go through the day as the metro station is blocks away. One day we had to leave the hotel at 6,30 am and they were very generous to put the breakfast at 6 that is one hour before its original time.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a helping hand”
Reviews.Author: Irishgirlabroad
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this supposed 4* hotel by Turkish Airlines for 2 nights when they cancelled our flight. It is well located just off Taksim Square so bus and metro services are on the doorstep. Staff were reasonably friendly and helpful, rooms appeared to be clean but the hotel has all the charm of a left luggage depot. When you walk in the door you just can't help feeling sad...and that is not the emotion I expect when first checking in...the lobby is depressing and the lack of lighting does nothing to help (half the area had no lights on at all). On the first floor the restaurant area is large and lack-lustre with lighting more appropriate to a bus station and certainly not somewhere anyone would want to sit for a meal. (which we had to the first day we arrived for lunch but after that we just ate out as we did not want to sit, on our own, in the empty dining room, particularly as there are so many great restaurants in the area). The standard rooms are long and narrow and felt quite claustrophobic - however the reception did offer us an alternative room on the 8th floor which was a lot better in term of light and there was a balcony outside which offered views over the town to the Bosphorus. (However we could not get out to it as it was locked). The bed unfortunately felt like it was made of straw and while the sheet fit the bed the duvet only came to the top edge of the mattress so luckily the heating worked as otherwise it would have been rather cold as the moment someone turned over in the bed..the duvet would stop covering you. The "amenities" offered in the room were a small bar of soap by the hand basin in the bathroom (and only when in the shower did it become apparent that it was the only piece of soap in the room !). The bathroom itself was small with no external ventilation. There was a tiny sewing kit in the desk drawer. The "mini-bar" had seen better days and needed a clean (both inside and around the cabinet) The room was carpeted but also felt a bit like straw underfoot. The lifts were rather small and dark and well worn..and the hallway carpets just looked like they needed replacing. There is a pool, sauna and hamman area in the basement..but it also seemed small, dark and well worn to the extent it almost seemed seedy...(plus there is a 10TL additional charge to use the sauna). The whole place has good bones...but the appearance of being managed by people with no interest in customer service. If you want a bed in a hotel near to Taksim Square this passes the test but don't expect anything other than the bare minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Karin S
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul on a work conference & was advised we were staying at the Crystal Hotel. All the reviews were not great so I was not expecting much. This hotel is a 5 min walk from Taksim Square. When I arrived at my room, I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were a decent size & the beds & pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was also great, except the shower was in the bath (with a glass door which I loved) but some people could find this difficult getting in & out as the side of the bath is higher than normal. The breakfast is not great but I found Istanbul pretty affordable so was happy to go have breakfast else where...so I do recommend taking the room without breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel if you are a true traveller, meaning you just need somewhere which is clean & safe & to sleep...as the rest of the time you will be out & about.

Reviews.Title: “reasonably good”
Reviews.Author: maribahar
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to Istanbul.the hotel was good sp. good situation in taxim square.the worst thing about all the taxim hotels is the crowd and noise.from 7 am to12 pm you coud not open the window.the staff were good but the management was poor.one ofthe front desk man was unpolite and somehow rude.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Reem R
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Perfect location, close to everything and the view is amazing. The restaurant is very nice, with a variety of food, different than any other 4 stars hotel i stayed in before. I recommend this hotel for anyone wants to enjoy his/her stay in Istanbul whether with friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Ri_Ra_11
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect , the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The house cleaning staff are very clean and neat. The hotel location is perfect close to everything, restaurants, cafes, supermarket and pharmacy. The hotel is quiet and you can have a good relaxation with the different services, the pool and massage everything and at the same time it is close to the crowd if u wanna go out and enjoy. The food was really nice and they variety of the buffet is really good , i really enjoys the vacation in this hotel, and by the way this is the 6th time i go to this hotel, "I LOVE IT". And i really respect the general manager for his effort, and he helped me once when my reservation was cancelled in another hotel, i went to this hotel by coincidence and he welcomed us and was very supportive and reserved a room for me on the spot. I really appreciate this hotel and whenever i'll go to Istanbul i will go there. I recommend it and enjoy ur vacation :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: Leyla774
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on a recommendation from a friend. Either the place has gone downhill since she stayed there or we had some bad luck! The location is good if you want to stay in Taksim - very close to the main drag but quiet. However I would never stay in Taksim again - too crowded, crossing the street was a life and death experience! The room we had was nice, but the shower leaked all over the floor, and although we let reception know and they said they would fix it, it wasn't fixed. They provide a fruit basket on arrival which is nice, and the breakfast was pretty good. The hotel was full of arabic tour groups, which created a noisy and crowded environment.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible overpriced hotel! Don't believe their internet pictures!”
Reviews.Author: Cath1980
Reviews.Content: Positive aspects: nice location and easy connection with the rest of the city, free wifi 24/7 Negative aspects: reception staff not friendly nor helpfull, tiny room (you lucky if you get one with a window), very bad sound isolation (specially when near the elevators), not clean at all, really overpriced for a so called 4 stars hotel, bad service for breakfast (dirty tables, not enough place for everyone, poor quality of food and drinks)

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hotel with bad towels and rugs”
Reviews.Author: zumaqueen
Reviews.Content: no A/C and a heavy duvet made sleeping almost impossible. The hotel is clean, the bathroom adequate. The breakfast buffet included a variety of vegetables, yogurt, cheese and breads. Location is far from the Sultanmet district where most tourist attractions are located.

Reviews.Title: “The WOREST!”
Reviews.Author: JenanJamal
Reviews.Content: the worest hotel I've ever stayed in! Room was too small. few Electronic Plugs! only 2 in the room & the 3rd in the bathroom! cooking smell in the room .. specially in the night! WiFi was not working proply .. sometimes its discounted and it will contect in the day after! but it has good location for Taksim! Bad Staff Specially in the Breakfast Hall! [ it was 9:20 am and the breakfast closed @ 10:00 they refused to give us knifes & forks!!! ]

Reviews.Title: “This so called 4 star rated Hotel is worst then any 2 star rated hotel from any metro city in India”
Reviews.Author: RocksyRocks
Reviews.Content: Can u imagine a 4 star Hotel, which: 1) Doesn't believe in providing Tea kettles in the rooms. Even non star rated hotels in India including guest houses provides it. 2) Breakfast spread resembles "langer" or community kitchen. Don't even bother to put food items name tags for people to identify what they are eating. Idea of segregating Veg & Non Veg fodd items would have never occuered to them. 3) Has "Health Club" which opens only after 10:00 AM 4) They refuse to provide iron box and would proudly suggest to use their laundry service. 4) And top of it highly incourteous staff. a. - If they pick your phone, you shpuld consider your self lucky. b. If they don't bang phone down, if you fail to communicate your requirement (obviously, they expect you to learn their language & slang before visiting them, its' not their problem if many of their staff don;t understand English well) - your luckier. c. - Howvere, even if you have succeeded in explaining your requirement but, if the service requested is not chargeble such as request for clean water glass in your room, please don't wait for it. It will not come.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in istanbul, Excellent service,location and value”
Reviews.Author: Johnetem
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked into the hotel we felt at home .The staff was wonderful.Extremely helpful and friendly.The location is excellent. We walked to all the major sites and there were many good restaurants within a few minutes walk We didn't want to leave. Breakfast was very good and is far beyond what you need for a long touring day.The rooms are very nicely decorated,quiet and neat. Good bathroom and good bed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Vdawar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Crystal is situated at Taxism Square, the location of the hotel is awesome. The reason i say that my stay was not satisfactory is due to very small and uncomfortable rooms, you start feeling choked inside the hotel. Most of the time i preferred sitting in the lobby, then finally i decided to change the hotel. Even the hotel staff knew about the problem with the hotel, they didn't charge anything for cancelling three days reservation. Other than hotel rooms, staff is very good, helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not more than 2 stars, believe me, avoid it, and the fire escape is more dangerous than the fire itself”
Reviews.Author: TehranFarzaneh
Reviews.Content: i stayed with 2 friends for 6 nights, the first triple room,s door opened into the restaurant! believe me, and the window opened into a small bare damp room with 2 holes in opposite walls!! you couldn't say it is day or night, we objected and given a room on 8th floor with terrible noise from an air-conditioning plant down all 24 hours. the reception guy is unresponsive to complaints. they charged us for triple room but it was a double with third bed a makeshift one, everything was 2, towels, glasses, bedlamps,chairs, didn't even brought the third towel after 5 days, and they insisted it was triple standard. no fresh fruits for breakfast. 2 stars at most. such a bloody experience, never again. if not there for shopping, go to sultan ahmet area and find a small cosy and less expensive hotel the fire escape was first blocked by the unhinged door to the stairs and then they removed the door but it had no railing and very narrow and dangerous to descend especially in the times of emergency and in a hurry

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: RKB1952
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while on a vacation to Turkey. Our travel agent booked this by offering us several choices on the internet , and we selected this one as it appeared to be quite good. The hotel location is superb, especially for Indians as an Indian restaurent 'MUSAFFIR' is situated adjacent to the hotel. The hotel is situated in the Taksim area which can be considered a centre. The area has a lareg number of class restaurents, local eating joints, fast food centres, coffee houses and shopping streets within five to ten minutes of walking distance. Unfortunately the hotel itself is below the standard that one would expect in a four star property. There is no coffee maker in room, only one soap bar to be shared by two occupants, and no basic toilet items like toothbrush/paste, body lotion, conditioner etc. They run the central airconditioning as per thier own system regardless of whether the guests are comfortable or not. On my next visit to Istanbul I will most certainly choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “aweful”
Reviews.Author: pouya_10
Reviews.Content: I am wondering about this hotel . 4 star !!! first of all i would like to say about begining . reception man was very rude and impolite . he don't speak english well (as all pepole in turkey ! ) and he don't any friendly feeling with pepoles and guests . check in was aweful long and indisposed . room is very small and my own haven't natural light and air . (window was opened in pasio ) .. but breakfast was normal not prefect but O.K . place is good if you want anywhere in city you can in taksim squre . you go with metro - bus - dolmush (mini bus) or taxsi . attrection place for shopping is near this place (esteghlal street and etc ... ) .

Reviews.Title: “Crystal hotel, breakfast is Ok but dinner is not.”
Reviews.Author: RMCYR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the Metro and all the buses at Tarsim Square. Lots of shops, cafes, bars close too. The spiral stairs are difficult to nagivate as the elevators are slow. The staff can get testy as they only understand minimal English and get frustrated easily with you. Water is expensive here, just go outside and pick up a bottle for 50 cents. You can't sleep early in the morning because it is close to a Mosque and they broadcast prayers as the sun comes up. Sounds like he is in your room with you saying them. The rugs are stained and the bath tub I had pulled away from the wall and had moldy grout. The breakfasts are good but the milk was soured and got clumpy in my coffee. We had a dinner at the hotel, It was very dry chicken with rice and potato (very yellow colored). I might stay there again if only for the location but I would shop around for better priced hotels near there first, and definitely go out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's it ...”
Reviews.Author: Arindam G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel near Taksim Square for 5 nights in June 2010. The only good thing about the hotel is the excellent location. Otherwise, all the drawbacks faced by boarders as was known to me from reading all past reviews of the hotel by members of Trip Advisor, unfortunately proved to be true. The hotel airconditioning was not functional, liquid soap was provided as the only toiletries, very average and uninspiring room decor and very ordinary breakfast doen not justify the 4 star rating of the hotel and the hotel is definitely not value for money. I would not recommend it unless someone had the same predicament of planning a trip in the last hour with not many better alternatives available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service, but Rooms are bad”
Reviews.Author: N0uchie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very close to Taksim Square, around 2 mins walk. it is situated on a quiet street near el Istiqlal street. the rooms are very small, and our room had no windows! Good for the shopping folks.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable trip”
Reviews.Author: daryoush-d
Reviews.Content: me and my family spent 7 days in this hotel. room was clean but a little small, very comfort and silent at nights, breakfast pretty and fresh, this hotel for istanbul travelers that spend more times inside city and reach more fast to touristic places is excellent option , Good trip!

Reviews.Title: “upset”
Reviews.Author: yan_yan19
Reviews.Content: i stay 4 nights there clean ,excellent location,near metro station,close to taksim square,..the breakfast is ok. the witress not very good,impolite ,small pool, small rooms my first day chek in was bad the room aircondition not working .. wifi conection is good on first day 3rd day no connection at all

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 * hotel”
Reviews.Author: TehranFarhad
Reviews.Content: i was 4 nights there with my friend ,very good location,near metro station,close to taqsim sq,..,clean,but ordinary breakfast not very good stuff,impolite reception,small pool,thin wall between rooms and small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: MCassatt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok, but has definitely seen better days. The room walls were thin, the elevators constantly broke down, and could not reliably handle more than 4 persons at a time. The furnishings looked a bit worn down. The staff was helpful and professional, though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Capital06
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location to start exploring Ä°stanbul. Very close to metro station and aerobus. Clean and comfy rooms. Free internet for laptops. Touristic area. But average breakfast. No slippers in the room. Lack of more toilet amenities. Helpful but no smiling staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Habiba80
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not big and bathrooms are too tiny, food is not exceptional yet rooms are clean on time and service is very fast, plus the location is quiet exceptional close to subway, bus station, plenty of taxis around and a walking distance from Isteklal Cad which is even better

Reviews.Title: “It is not more than one star!!”
Reviews.Author: abounasr
Reviews.Content: terrible , very small pool and dirty, rude stuff, very bad services, and small and dirty rooms!! the Air conditioning does not work. the internet wireless does not work, we complain many times but no one attention. no slippers in rooms. only the place and breakfast was good. but don't even think about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: masenafar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, our check in and check out process was very quieck , breakfasr was very good , but the room was small. It was almost in Taqsim square and metro , taxi and bus was available without any trouble, very very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrated”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl45
Reviews.Content: the hotel was below my expectations. I think management needs to improve customer service and the way they treat customers. It seemed like most of the customers who stay are one time visitors or tourists who will probably never come again, so they dont really care to maintain them. Few points to note: 1- We have paid for a room with 3 beds but we just got a room with two with an add on child bed. this made it impossible to walk since the rooms are really tiny. Reception desk has difficulty communicating in a language other than turkish. 2- It was close to 30 C degrees and we have been told that the air condition gets turned off at night to conserve energy. Opening windows in not an option since it is very noisy outside. 3- No internet in the rooms or anywhere else in the hotel. On the good side: 1- beds are comfy 2- location is great! 3- bathrooms are nice

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful!”
Reviews.Author: wisetravellerman
Reviews.Content: Are you reading this as you make arrangements for your travels to Istanbul? Are you considering the possibility of staying at the Crystal? Listen to me: LOOK ELSEWHERE, and considered yourselves saved. I wish I had gone through the reviews earlier. It's harder to paint a more horrible picture than it has been painted in previous reviews, but believe me: I am an aged traveller. I have seen all sorts of hotels, from Cambodian holes to brothels. This join their ranks. When I arrived in Istanbul, on a business trip, I had made no bookings, so this was arranged for me last minute at the airport travel desk. I paid as much as Euro 150/night for a single room in the hotel and was happy I was awarded one of the better rooms. This turns up to be a disgustingly dirty room, with stained carpet flooring, and a smell that would have you throw up as you step in. The temperature is akin to that of a Turkish bath (so, I suppose, it would save you having to go through that experience), which makes it nearly impossible to sleep. The noise from the the street, from the nearby clubs and from the cars on Taksim square is enough to keep you awake all night. The service at the reception downstairs is awful and the hotel amenities are just plain ugly. The swimming pool at level -1 doubles, I believe, as the hotel sewage. The 'prestige' terrace on the 8th floor is home to abandoned pieces of furniture. The breakfast in the morning is a work of art - Tracy Emin could find inspiration for her next piece - as stuff that you never thought could be eaten finds its way on the main display. I pity those who, like me, come here after having paid the agency at the airport, for there's no turning back or having your money refunded so that you can move to a better location. If you are lucky enought to have a choice, you'd be a fool to be wanting to stay here. What I find even more irritating, reading other people's review, is that the hotel manager will stick a completely meaningless message after this post making you believe that you will be welcomed back to a rennovated hotel, which is all about 'prestige' and 'hello!'. If you are masochist enough to be wanting to check if their word is true, please, be their guest.

Reviews.Title: “It was good”
Reviews.Author: Ayman_hnaif
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights with my wife at Crystal hotel, it was good not real 4 stars but when choosing my room i tried to find front room, its small but in general it was good. they had renew hotel paints and rooms. it good when compare with same level of hotels

Reviews.Title: “not more than 1 star”
Reviews.Author: bmalzoubi
Reviews.Content: old building lying not friendly staff old painted rooms old bathrooms most lights were broken no iron no in room internet small room small beds

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul over Easter”
Reviews.Author: Clerkenwell
Reviews.Content: This was my sixth trip to Istanbul over the past six years and I've stayed in a different hotel each time. My wife and I have tried Boutique, Tourist and International style of venues in Sultanahmet, Tunel and Taksim districts. The Crystal is a newly refurbished "four" star tourist class hotel in the Taksim district. The venue was chosen for a large group of us to attend a family wedding. We were able to secure a good discount off the rack rate by booking through a third party agency. The hotel is located just off Cumhuriyet Caddesi, a stone's throw from Taksim Square. This provides an ideal base to explore BeyoÄŸlu to the south and the more modern districts to the north. The trip to Sultanahmet is highly dependent on the traffic, however it should take no more than 40 minutes using the funicular and the tram. Another plus point is that the Airport HavaÅŸ bus terminates 100 metres from the front door. No hotel in Istanbul will be ideally located for all the attractions but the Crystal's position is as good as any for the independent traveller, who doesn't want to depend on taxis. Check in was efficient. We had been allocated a twin room but this was easily switched to a double. Unfortunately we were allocated a tiny room with an even smaller window. I would recommend that you don't accept room 12 on any of the floors as they are not of 4* quality. We didn't make a fuss immediately as we were were trying to avoid offending the organisers but, after seeing the rooms allocated to our friends, we complained to the manager. He happily changed our room to larger one with a nice big window. The room rate includes en-suite bath or shower, use of the hotel pool that we didn't see, free wireless internet access and breakfast. The rooms are newly decorated, with minibar and an LCD television on the wall. The bed was firm and comfortable, the shower powerful - all as you would wish for at an establishment of this price. The bar was overpriced, as is every hotel bar in Istanbul and the breakfast uninspiring. In conclusion, I have stayed in better hotels in Istanbul with more character, but not for this price. It is not in the same league as The Bentley, The Intercontinental or The Divan (currently knocked down and waiting to be rebuilt) but is comparable to The Point. I would recommend The Crystal Hotel for a friend at the rate that we paid (less than â‚¬100 per room per night) but not the published â‚¬175 as listed at reception

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: ruthL36
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights while attending an event in Istanbul. Room was ok - asked for a non-smoking room but found the room with an ashtray. Probably can't be helped - many people seem to smoke in Turkey. It was a reasonable size; not the double I booked, but a twin. Not much in the way of storage space, to be honest, but it was adequate. I found my room far too hot, even with the aircon off (the cooling facility didn't seem to work at all). The lobby bar was ok - nothing special and it wasn't cheap, but there are plenty of places nearby to use for a more reasonbly priced drink. The breakfast was good - plenty of choice. Was going to try the swimming pool but it was closed a few times and then when we did get in, the man there told us the pool was very cold. We tried it, and it was! So we gave that a miss..... If you're looking for luxury, this hotel isn't that. But if you want a reasonable room, in a handy location for Taksim Square (and all the shops, bars and restaurants!), this hotel is worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: lblahnik
Reviews.Content: The Crystal Hotel was a huge disappointment. We stayed here on the recommendation of a travel agent in Istanbul. The lobby didnt seem bad but when we got to our room, it was terrible. The bedspreads smelled like terrible body odor so we promptly threw them on the floor. The bathroom smelled like urine. The room was so hot that we sweating all night. We tried to turn on the airconditioning but more heat came out! The check-in process was smooth, however, and even though we were late for checkout time, they did not give us a hard time. This hotel is supposed to be a 4 star, but I would not even give it one.

Reviews.Title: “The Truth of The Crystal Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ahmedew
Reviews.Content: Hello, well basically to sum all this up in a nut shell, and not to make this too long, i have returned from a spectacular trip to istanbul, turkey. But the only downfall of the vacation was mostly the hotel. This hotel is a complete NO NO for people who like to lounge in a hotel all day or expect to sun bath in the medit. sun; Firstly let me start by saying, that not all the previous reviews were right, when i arrived at my hotel i was greeted warmly by a bell man called mourad, then was shown to two suites, situated on the 8th and 9th floor (9th floor only accessible by stairs or taking the lift to the 8th and clambering over 30+ steps). Upon arrival the rooms we're airy and bright, but not of the 4* rating it maintained. The real definition of a 4* hotel is have a specific size of room which is around 5m squared less than a 5* hotel; and come to think of it, was more than 3/4 missing. Yet it must have fully working TV with a working remote controller, a fridge that is well ventilated to prevent over-heating, fresh clean towels per day and more to add, the towels must also coincide with the number of people living in this cave. We were 5 people and 3 towels were laid out in the disgraceful toilet, ordered more and left to tour the city, came back and didn't find any floor towels, nor hand towels but found 5 large towels, so there playing the game of substitution. Further the more, the A/C is claimed to be 'fully controllable' from your room, but nope the hotel switches off the A/C from 10am till 6pm?? And what more is that they push there luck even more but not supplying the fully A/C power available, for god sake if if i was to blow over my children it would have been better. Almost forgot there were a couple of power surges and then the generators kicked in, the gennys kept working for about 3-4 hours, and to top everything off, is that this was all at around 12:30 midnight and you couldn't sleep till 4am and had to cancel our planned trip due to a lack of sleep and rest. The breakfast is completely stomach churning and uneatable, the eggs look aged, the omelets aren't freshly made, the bread is availible in certain amounts, the water is provide in shot glasses, the 'fresh' orange juice is more like, preserved orange powder with added water and tonnes of sugar, the salads look soggy and harmful. the only best thing about this hotel is the balcony on the 8th floor, but this balcony was stated as a night cafe offering refreshing drinks and food at night, but nothing was offered, no tables laid, nothing. The view depending on where my room was situated was mind blowing, i had a clear view of the bosphorus bridge and sea along with the ill rejected hyatt, intercontinental and ritz. (the only reason i stayed in this dump [The crystal hotel] was that there were no rooms allocated for me on the dates required). The location of the hotel is quite appealing aswell, its only a 20meters away from the subway, which takes you to istanbuls shopping districts and a majority of the touristic attractions and hotspots. Its also a 2 min walk (timed) from the istaklal street with designer shops from lacoste to diesel. and a 15 min walk from the super rich 'Mecca street' with ultra-designer shops like Louis Vuitton, Beymen, Burberry etc. (Louis Vuitton is a must, bought a wallet, bag and glasses, the very best). So Basically, this is a complete no no as i said for hotel loungers, but yet its okay for people who'll be all over istanbul touring and sightseeing. This hotel should be renamed the rock or the stone not The Crystal as i cannot see the clarity of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experince at the Crystal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timothy08
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the crystal hotel an 29th july 08 and found most of the staff impolite. Shown to our room which was to dity to stay in with a very unpleasant smell. So we changed rooms for one not much better. The bathroom was very unpleasent , bath plug hole was black, beds not clean enough to sleep in so we had to sleep on towels, carpet dirty like everywhere else. Breakfast was terrible apart from the coffee. When asked for a receipt we were told to wait a minute that minute turned into 1 hour, with a taxi waiting outside to take us to the airport 30 minutes, we finally left without a receipt. we paid Â£200 for one night in a 4star hotel. The only reason we picked this hotel on this occasion was because of the swimming pool and it was the last night of our family holiday before returning to England. The swimming pool was full of hair floating round and the changing rooms were dirty. We would never stay in this hotel again and would not recommend and one else to. This was a bad end to a really good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Crystal was not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Massoud010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a great location near Taksim Square, the Istiklal Road, the Metro and the bus station, but doesn't suit the hot temperatures in summer! So don't stay there in July-August. The air conditioning only makes noise but doesn't cool. We slept with open windows and we coped. The staff and the breakfast were great. The room OK.

Reviews.Title: “Mono Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marmartt
Reviews.Content: our travel agent found the hotel for us that was the worth hotel i have ever seen. just check the pictures taken by the hotel guests and imagine you see the same thing or worth. the rooms are very small, the room carpet is dirty ,the bed sheets are not clean, bathroom and the toilet are terrible, the most important thing was the AC which was not working and the room itself does not have a good air conditioning so even breathing can be difficult sometimes, the fridge does not working properly. I donâ€™t know who gave 4 stars to this hotel even the guy in the reception was rude he doesnâ€™t know how to behave and treat the people. we stayed only one night in that place and we left instead of wasting time and money on that place.

Reviews.Title: “Crystal Hotel, How do I hate thee, let me count the ways...”
Reviews.Author: jeff801
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Crystal Hotel, Istanbul by our meeting organizers. Room: 1. Tiny, but we got moved 2. Second room had two beds, either would have been discarded as cruel and unusual punishment by most US jails. 3. The carpet crunched as we walked on it. Yet it was cleaner than the rest of the room. 4. The walls were so thin that we heard normal conversations through them, as well as the sound of the elevator chime at all times. 5. The sheets were to small for the bed, and had the thread count of a kitchen towel. 6. The TV was terrible but it only carried BBC news and CNN so it did not matter. 7. There was no drawer space at all and only two of the five hangers in the tiny closet could hold clothing. Bathroom: 1. The soap was so small, I could not find it without my glasses on. 2. The towels were thin and had the consistency of sandpaper 3. The shower head was partially blocked, and the curtain was to short for the tub; leading to a flood every time the shower was used. 4. The first bathroom was so tiny that one had to stand up to clean after using the toilet. 5. The mildew level met laboratory standards. Other: 1. WiFi was available in the smoke filled lobby, but usually the lights were off and it was impossible to find a plug without crawling around the floor with a flashlight. 2. The included breakfast was mostly mystery meat and terrible bread, coffee and watery scrambled eggs. 3. There was a non-smoking area in the dining room, but it was behind the smoking area and the smoking area surrounded the buffet. 4. The staff was naive about the city, could not understand the simplest requests, and had no information about public transportation. We walked over to the Intercontinental for concierge help. There are more things on this list, but I feel I have ranted enough. All things considered, the only place I have ever stayed at that was worse, but cleaner, was when I borrowed a cell in an upstate New York town at which I arrived too late at night to book a room.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill028
Reviews.Content: The foyer has been pretty lavishy appointed but the rooms (we stayed in 2 on 7th floor) were adequate - in need of refurbishment but overall reasonably clean. Reception was always understaffed though the receptionist did a valiant job; communication was poor since our requests for clothes hangars never was acted upon. Staff were reasonably friendly and we never were ignored - though it seems customary for Turkish speakers to have long animated conversations. Overall this should be a 3 star hotel until the rooms and the facade match each other. It was not as bad an experience as some posting suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Crystal”
Reviews.Author: rabramov
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Crystal Hotel for four nights in January and enjoyed it very much. It is a centrally located, clean hotel, the rooms are pretty much spacious. The hotel staff and service made our stay enjoyable, they helped us and gave some tips about the surroundings... you cannot be regretful if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “so terrible”
Reviews.Author: syeed372
Reviews.Content: Well, this is my first day in Crystal Hotel. My fisrst impression about this hotel is so terrible that i decided to inform other travellers about the hotel. i've checked in 3 hours, before entering the lobby i couldn't find any porter offering help with luggage, so I hadd to carry in my two large luggage on my own. the check in was ok, and the lobby seems fine too. the hotel offers free WI-FI internett access, which i am using now, in the lobby. although it is called Lobby Lounge, i can't see any waiter nearby to collect 2 half-full Turkish tea glasses which was left by 2 girls-guest almost 1 hour ago. one of the main problems in the hotel is that there is no enough written information about the services (included or extra) in rooms or other public places. we located on A floor wich is upside th Lobby floor. the room and the furnitures are very small, and all the equipments are about 30 years old. the TV is 13-14" old one, the door lock is half-broken, the bathroom is dirty with stains in the bathtube, but the towels are clean, the room itself needs to be refurbished thoroughly. THERE IS NO WINDOW IN THE ROOM, welll this is enough for now, tomorrow i will share the feeling about the nigh in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate. The hotel is fine!”
Reviews.Author: plzsec
Reviews.Content: We booked the Crystal as part of a flight+hotel deal and after reading the other reviews, I was pretty worried what I would find. I'm glad to say, that for the price we paid, the hotel was just fine! We were there for four nights and considering we were going to IStanbul to see the sites, and not lounge around the hotel, it served our purposes just fine. We stayed in a very large double room on the fifth floor. The sheets were a little skimpy, but clean and blankets nice and warm (The heat also worked well)True, the water in the shower/bath didn't drain so quickly, but there was always plenty of hot water and clean towels. The hotel breakfast was also fine - a selection of meats and cheeses, some hot dishes, fresh bread, etc. The reception clerks tried their best to help us out with directions to the sites. Note that this hotel is very centrally located - about a three minute walk from the metro and bus stops, and about 10 minutes away by foot from the Dolmabahcie Palace (Highly recommended to visit!) and the Bakatas port stop where you can take a boat to the other side of the Bosphorous. So if you get this hotel at a good price, and plan on spending most of your day touring - go for it and enjoy! If you plan just on lounging around the hotel all day and expect a lot of amenities, then maybe keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4* !”
Reviews.Author: varyora
Reviews.Content: We were staying in this hotel end of 2007 with husband .The only one goo thing in hotel - lacation in the center of Taxim , but thats only one .On the 1st day we arrived we got a very small and tiny room that had a broken air condition and had no window !!.We went dont to reception and asked to change romm, we were promised that room will be changed tomorrow morning and our stuff will be in new room when we come back in the afternoon, next day room was changed only at 6 p.m.And new one was almost the same , we went back to reception again and already demand about other room but the guy at the reception( Mehmet or whatever was his name) was really rude telling "He is tired of us!" - after this phrase we bursted out and seing that its already scandal he gave us other room ! The bathroom was too old and the toilet had stain of rust , the tv was15" screen which was too small, they still using keys instead of magnetic cards for door, the breakfast was the bad quality as well-the "orange juice"was some kind of concentrate mixed with water and had a terrible taste. I will not recomend this hotel to anybody , especially as 4 * !There are a lot of better places around Taxim !

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: navigator1212
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to go to Istanbul for the big Eid holiday. We booked our trip through Holiday Travel, Amman, Jordan. They gave us an attractive package which included a 4-star hotel, breakfast included, full tours for 3 days and roundtrip tickets. Unfortunately, the hotel was not 4-star material. We were very disappointed b/c the rooms were gloomy. It was warm in Istanbul at the time and the A/C in our room was not working. The front desk informed us that they shut off all A/C units b/c people were complaining that it was too cold!! (??? what?!!) The 12-inch TV was at least 40 years old with limited channels. The bathroom was decent but there were all sort of hair on the floor, if you catch my drift! (yuck) and the tub was old with mold on the edges. The only good thing about the bathroom was the unbelievable water pressure in the shower and the clean towels. For a 4-star hotel, the sheets should be impeccable and changed everyday. However, one of our beds had sheets which were stained with something brown/black. The breakfast buffet was very good. They had all sorts of meats, eggs, fruits, yogurts, bread, vegetables, etc. The only problem we had the whole time we were there is the staff. They were not organized and very very rude. I was shocked!!!! I think this hotel was misadvertised as a 4-star hotel. I blame our travel agent who encouraged us to stay there and guaranteed our satisfaction. Word of advice, believe the other reviews about this hotel...Most hit the nail on the head. Other people on our tour stayed at Larespark Hotel (down the street from Crystal) and they loved it. Divan Hotel, Nippon, and Boutique Hotels were praised (all in Taksim close to Crystal). Holiday Travel promised us a 3-day tour, but we arrived to find out there are none. We joined a different travel group and had an amazing time. Istanbul was fabulous, so rich with history and culture. Enjoy your time!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: squeez700
Reviews.Content: I saw the Reviews before i went to that Hotel , it was Terrible and i didn't accept it. after i went , the hotel was the most Terrible and horrible hotel ever , no services, rude people , baddddddd rooms (imagine ur taking a bath and mud comes out ) , cracked fridge , awful view , worst breakfast , i really can't find the bad word to describe it , donttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttt goooooo

Reviews.Title: “Dont go there please!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sh0sh0
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel on June 2007 with my husband.our room was in the 6th floor. The only good thing about this hotel is the location. The place was horable for the following reasons: 1.the a/c in our room was not working 2.there was a problem in the water drainage of the bathtub.The water will never go it will reach up to your knee. 3.There was no water for 1 day. 4.the breakfast was less than average.the restaurant was very small and no a/c.No variaty of food available.if you go at 9 you will not find something to eat!!! 5.the reception people were very rude even the females!!! 6.the view from the window was very bad. We were supposed to stay there for 12 days ,we didnt complete 48 hrs and transfered to 50m away hotel ERISEN HOTEL it was amazing. I strongly recomend this hotel if you want to enjoy your vacation in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: nouna616
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for a week in july 2007, it was like a nightmare. the rooms are very small & tiny, bed sheets are not clean (having stains) and the bathrooms are disgusting no soap. Also the receptionists were very rude not willing to help. regarding the breakfast we had the same kind of food everyday for a week witout changing even a single item...............Finally this hotel is really horrible.

Reviews.Title: “2 1/2 stars (maybe)”
Reviews.Author: ehrnjic
Reviews.Content: Cons: -Air conditioning was not working. -Beds were VERY uncomfortable. -Hotel is one big smoking area. -TV is very small. -They forgot to bring new soap in the bathroom two days in a row. -No water fountains / coolers around (this might be specific for every hotel in Turkey - I don't know). Waiter didn't let me fill my water bottle during the breakfast in the restaurant. - Roof bar is a joke. Pros: -Location is fantastic - minutes away from Taksim square. -(Some) stuff speak very good English. -They were nice. -Lobby is very decent. Disclaimer: I didn't go to swimming pool, sauna, massage, Turkish bath. Nevertheless, Istanbul is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Misafir
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great location, good breakfast but the best asset is simply the genuine friendliness and helpfullness of the staff. Having backpacked around the world twice I have never stayed in a more friendlier place. Special thanks to Halil in reception for all his help.

Reviews.Title: “upper floors: nice”
Reviews.Author: natalie_d_z
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, 5 minutes walking from taksim square, near many bus stations. We got a room on the 5th floor. The room was spacious, very clean and lightened. We understood later from other visitors that there is quite a difference beteween the floors: The lower floors contained much smaller rooms, and it was noisy as well. on the 5th floor the noise was noticable only when the window was open, but that's a reasonable price to pay for being so close to the center. The breakfast was exactly the same each day (from the 8 days we were there), and it wasn't so good. but, from cheking the cafes nearby, that is the turkish breakfast everywhere. the staff was generally kind and spoke english (a rare thing in turkey). in sum- good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “unacceptable!”
Reviews.Author: ist2007
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the roommaid has just closed the door of our room and we thought we will find it clean. Ok, at first sight its clean externally. I went to the bathroom and the lavatory basin had the clean strip over the cover. Under the second plastic cover there were many drops of piss (sign that the woman didn't clean it at all!!!) the bathroom cleaning was hurry and in the bath were some hair (you know...)! I bought chlorine water from a market and i cleaned the bathroom. Its not my business but its my hygiene and healthy! Windows were dirty, in the ceiling-roof has humidity from upstairs bathroom i think, the next rooms greet the ears when they had bath and the best i ve listened was that the alarm ball in the center of ceiling-roof was secret camera for the hotel safety!!! They monitor us every moment. Sickening! Thats all! Have a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Contrary to most other reviews - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aravasouth
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at this hotel with a group from Israel. I was very wary before arrival, having read the mostly VERY negative reviews here. Contrary to the past reviews, the hotel was clean, pleasant, and enjoyable. The bathroom was spotless, the towels and linens were new and snowy white. The staff was polite and helpful. Breakfast was tasty and ample, with numerous choices of hot and cold foods. The coffee quality left something to be desired but overall every morning meal was satisfying and the dining room clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the right place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: empathy34
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after 3 nights at this lovely hotel.we stayed this hotel several times.and we really love this hotel..this time we had big suprise..they changed everything at the hotel from the doors to rooms.the new color of hotel Ä±s magnificiant..We most certainly weren't disappointed and this hotel more than lived up to our expectations. We stayed in the Room no 1912, with a little balcony overlooking the charming little Bosphours and nice sea view.. The room was very spacious with a huge two posted bed, sitting area and wardrobe The room was spotlessly clean and toiletries were provided in the bathroom which was a nice touch. the bellman and the receptionist boy made us very welcome indeed and it was nice chatting to them during our stay - they are very friendly and they make us as if we came to their home as a guest..they fascinated with the staff, fascinated with the services,again :)) We were able to reach all the attractions by ourselves by walking and everywhere is within easy access by the taxi. Smiling faces all over the hotel makes everything easier and it feels like home...if we get the chance to go to the magnificient city Istanbul again, this hotel is just the right place to stay. The room was spotlessly clean and toiletries were provided in the bathroom which was a nice touch. We found the hotel easy to find on arrival at TAKSÄ°M - the centre of city,the brain of entertainment :)) we were able to reach all the attractions by ourselves by walking and everywhere is within easy access by the taxis. Smiling faces all over the hotel makes everything easier and it feels like home.. .if I get the chance to go to the magnificient city Istanbul again, this hotel is just the right place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Crystal Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Receppasa Caddesi No:7 | Taksim, Istanbul 80090, Turkey
